intro: Apseudes caspica, commonly known as the Caspian sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the regions around the Caspian Sea. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in saline and alkaline soils, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its native habitat. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, and it produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Apseudes caspica is often found in coastal areas and salt marshes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
